channel.title: Make Windows Xp into Vista (Exact) Using WindowBlinds(etc.)
channel.description:
Want that beautiful sleek design of Windows Vista? But don't want that hefty price tag attached to it? Well, I've got good news for you, and it comes in the form of a program. During this tutorial I will cover the basic parts of installing WindowBlinds 5.1, Cracking it, and Installing the skins. As well as Installing Bootskin, Installing DesktopX, Icon Packager and their components. [center] End Result: [URL=http://img462.imageshack.us/my.php?image=vistasidebarkh7.jpg][IMG]http://img462.imageshack.us/img462/8947/vistasidebarkh7.th.jpg[/img][/URL]
[URL=http://img156.imageshack.us/my.php?image=windowstabya6.jpg][IMG]http://img156.imageshack.us/img156/640/windowstabya6.th.jpg[/img][/URL][/center]
[center][img]http://i28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/1.png[/img]
I. WindowBlinds -a. Installing -b. Cracking -c. Operating
II. Icon Packager -a. System Requirements -b. Download link
III. DesktopX -a. System Requirements -b. Download link
IV. BootSkin -a. System Requirements -b. Download link
V. Logon Studio -a. System Requirements -b. Download link
VI. Visual Task Tips
-b. Download link
VII. Themes -a. Desktop Theme -b. BootSkin -c. Logon Screen -d. Icon Package
VIII. Extra Links [/center]
[Center][IMG]http://s28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/2.png[/img][/Center]
I. WindowBlinds is a very tricky program to use for beginners, but it is also one of the easiest ways to skin your Desktop. In order for you to be able to work with this program, you must learn how to use it.
Programs Needed: -[url=http://rarlabs.com/rar/wrar37b6.exe]Winrar Archiver[/url]
-a. First, you must download the programs listed above, then, you must download WindowBlinds 5.1 from [url=http://rapidshare.com/files/8476992/WindowsBlinds___Crack.rar]Here[/url]. But, since it's a .rar file, you'll need to use the Winrar Archiver program to unarchive it, so, when it's done downloading, depending on what Internet Browser you are using, it will prompt you to open the file with Winrar Archiver.
System Requirements: (WindowBlinds 5.1)
* Windows XP/2003 or Windows Vista (when available). Windows 2000, ME, 98 users can use WindowBlinds Classic (v4.6). * 1GHz or faster processor recommended * 60MB free drive space * 256MB RAM * Note: A 16MB DirectX 8 or later compatible video card with appropriate driver support is required for per-pixel alpha-blended skins. Some integrated graphics solutions and lower-end cards from before 2004 may not be able to use per-pixel skins. * Languages Supported: Azerbaijani, Danish, Dutch, English, Finnish, French, German, Hungarian, Japanese, Korean, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese - BR, Russian, Spanish, Serbian (Srpski), Swedish, Turkish Note: The interface has been localized for these languages, but the documentation and help (where available) will be in English.
Size: 9.45MB Password to Open [code]se7ensins.com[/code]
[center][IMG]http://s28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/10.png[/img][/center]
-b. Follow the instructions on how to crack the program located inside of the file, otherwise, if you don't want to actually indanger yourself, you can use the trial version and then purchase it. Crack and Download Credit to TQDgamer98
-c. Now, as you can see, after you crack WindowsBlinds, and you open the program, there are a few sample skins given to you, they work fine, and look OK too, but, if you want more, I suggest you keep reading this tutorial.
[center][IMG]http://s28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/3.png[/img][/center]
II. Icon Packager is the Desktop Icon Replacer.
-a. System Requirements:
* Windows 2000/XP/2003/Vista * 50MB free drive space * 256MB RAM * Languages Supported: Danish, English, French, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Spanish Note: The interface has been localized for these languages, but the documentation and help (where available) will be in English.
-b. Here is the [url=http://dw.com.com/redir?pid=10529875&merid=80664&mfgid=80664&ltype=dl_dlnow&lop=link&edId=3&siteId=4&oId=3040-2195_4-10529875&ontId=2195_4&destUrl=http://www.download.com%2F3001-2195_4-10529875.html]download link[/url].
[center][IMG]http://s28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/4.png[/img][/center]
III. DesktopX is the equivalent of the Windows SideBar in Vista.
-a. System Requirements:
* Windows 2000/XP/2003/Vista * 20MB free drive space * 256MB RAM
[img]http://i.d.com.com/i/dl/media/dlimage/40/84/4084_large.jpeg[/img]
-b.Here is the [url=http://dw.com.com/redir?pid=10577569&merid=80664&mfgid=80664&ltype=dl_dlnow&lop=link&edId=3&siteId=4&oId=3040-2340_4-10577569&ontId=2340_4&destUrl=http://www.download.com%2F3001-2340_4-10577569.html]download link[/url].
[center][IMG]http://s28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/5.png[/img][/center]
IV. BootSkin is the Program that modifies the Start up screen, that, would normally Say "Windows Xp" This allows you to change that, to any Bootskin you'd like.
-a. System Requirements:
* Windows 2000/XP * 10MB free drive space * 256MB RAM
[img]http://www.jakeludington.com/images/xp/bootskin_screen.png[/img]
-b. Here is the [url=http://dw.com.com/redir?pid=10498208&merid=80664&mfgid=80664&ltype=dl_dlnow&lop=link&edId=3&siteId=4&oId=3040-2105_4-10498208&ontId=2105_4&destUrl=http://www.download.com%2F3001-2105_4-10498208.html]download link[/url].
[center][IMG]http://s28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/6.png[/img][/center]
V. Logon Studio
-a. System Requirements: *Windows XP for XP edition, Windows Vista for Vista edition *10MB free drive space *256MB RAM
[img]http://www.softpedia.com/screenshots/LogonStudio_1.png[/img]
-b. Here is the [url=http://w13.easy-share.com/1066400.html]Download link[/url].
[center][IMG]http://i28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/7.png[/img][/center]
VI. The Download link is [url=http://www.visualtasktips.com/download.php]here[/url]. It basically produces a smaller image of the program you are running on the taskbar, so you can preview the program before clicking on it.
[img]http://blog.so-net.ne.jp/_images/blog/_0e5/souseki/3730158.jpg[/img]
[center][IMG]http://s28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/8.png[/img][/center]
VII. There are a few different themes I've come across after using this program for as long as I have. and, here are a few that are probably the best of their kind.
-a. Desktop Theme (There are two different versions, just in case on doesn't work, you have the other you can use)
* [url=http://w13.easy-share.com/1066529.html]Windows Vista Aero V1[/url] * [url=http://w13.easy-share.com/1066540.html]Windows Vista Aero V2[/url]
-b. [url=http://w13.easy-share.com/1066472.html]Windows Vista Bootskin[/url]
-c. [url=http://w13.easy-share.com/1066476.html]Windows Vista Logon[/url]
-d. [url=http://w13.easy-share.com/1066468.html]Vista SideBar[/url]
-e. [url=http://w13.easy-share.com/1066466.html]Vista Aero Cursors[/url]
-f. [url=http://w13.easy-share.com/1066465.html]Windows Vista Icon Package[/url]
[center][IMG]http://s28.photobucket.com/albums/c219/slurpiebrain/9.png[/img][/center]
VIII. Extra Links: * [url=http://www.wincustomize.com]WinCustomize[/url] * [url=http://gallery.live.com/default.aspx?pl=1]WindowsLive Sidebar object search[/url] * [url=http://www.se7ensins.com]Se7enSins[/url] * [url=http://www.rs2gods.net]Rs2gods[/url] * [url=http://stardock.com/]Stardock[/url] * [url=http://rs2codes.com/]Rs2Codes[/url]
~Tutorial by me, ThAt0n36Uy, files credited to their respectful owners.
Tutorials coming soon: -Coding Full Internet Browsers in VB -Turning Kodak EasyShare C310 into a portable game station

item.title: Make Windows Xp into Vista (Exact) Using WindowBlinds(etc.)
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

pk4pk:

Why do all this when you can just download it in 1 package and restart your pc and be done within 10minutes? Go here www.crystalxp.net -Direct link- http://www.crystalxp.net/galerie/en.id.130.htm - Nice eh? [img]http://www.crystalxp.net/galerie/img/img-shell-packs-bricopack-vista-inspirat-ultimate-2-dlb-130.jpg[img]

Actually I use that ^ I like it a lot…I just switched over to the Vista bricopack after using the Crystal clear one for a while.

Read full topic

@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Exception:

I’ve done all this before, I got really bored of it after a while. All the programs combined can really bog down the average computer. Right now I’m just sticking with a hacked uxtheme.dll, and ViStart+Launchy.

That’s what I switched to.

item.title: Make Windows Xp into Vista (Exact) Using WindowBlinds(etc.)
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

That is to Patch WindowBlinds, nothing there would have changed anything, unless you changed the dll.lzo file in some other directory. And not in the WindowBlinds file. If you own an IBM, that would make sense. What is your Operating System? Xp?

Read full topic

item.title: Make Windows Xp into Vista (Exact) Using WindowBlinds(etc.)
item.dc:creator: @Divine-Devil Divine-Devil
item.description:
@Divine-Devil wrote:

Ok, I did everything It told me too, I changed that one DLL file to dll.lzo like it said

Then I copied and pasted it into the directory, And did overwrite the screen.exe, I did close the activation and Everything. I restarted my computer to find a IBM logo and a full blue screen saying S/C WARP, Then my mouse laid there hopelessly.

Read full topic
item.source: Make Windows Xp into Vista (Exact) Using WindowBlinds(etc.)

item.title: Make Windows Xp into Vista (Exact) Using WindowBlinds(etc.)
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You didn’t do something right, none of these programs modifies anything on your Mouse, as for the BootScreen issue, you must’ve done something on your own to have caused that, I know for sure that none of the other programs change your bootscreen, only BootSkin changes it, if you ran the program, and chose a skin. and the one it booted was a different one, that would be different. Either you’re lying, or you have some program previously installed that didn’t like working with these programs. And if that happens, all of the StarDock programs will warn you before hand if anything will be messed up.

Read full topic
item.source: Make Windows Xp into Vista (Exact) Using WindowBlinds(etc.)

item.title: Make Windows Xp into Vista (Exact) Using WindowBlinds(etc.)

item.description:
@Divine-Devil wrote:

Shall I never trust this again, First when I followed the TUT exactly right, It gives me a whole new bootscreen (didn’t even do that tut) then, My mouse is disabled?, MY norton went crazy, WOW. No mouse for an hour sucks!

Read full topic
